page.title: 14COMMUTING TO LONDON
page.content: My Dad gets up at 6.50 & then drives to Thorpe Station to catch the London train.Sometimes it's a bit late.At Liverpool Street,he buys a newspaper & catches a bus to Fleet Street where his office is. Dad starts work at 9.15. As a chartered accountant he looks after taxes for people. He puts his work on to a tape machine so the secretary can type letters to people. Lunch time is at 12.30 & sometimes my Dad shops in Central London or goes into the park. In the afternoon he often has to attend meetings.They finish work at 5.15 but often work until 6.15.On Monday evenings he plays badminton with his friends in London. He is home by 8.30 & we have dinner. Afterwards he takes our dogs out for a walk. On some nights my Dad goes to P.T.A. meetings.
